Job Description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.

NIKE is a technology company. From our flagship website and five-star mobile apps to developing products, managing big data and providing leading edge engineering and systems support, our teams at NIKE Global Technology exist to revolutionize the future at the confluence of tech and sport. We invest and develop advances in technology and employ the most creative people in the world, and then give them the support to constantly innovate, iterate and serve consumers more directly and personally. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary and collaborative, taking technology into the future and bringing the world with it.

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

We’re looking for a business operations specialist to help drive business operations and processes for our Technology Operations Business Operations & Enablement (BOE) team. The role strives to make the core components of what makes Tech Ops run as a business simple and easy. This role drives operational plans and process improvements for the Tech Ops team. This role partners with managers, multi-functional partners, and the team to ensure operational processes are followed, information is consistent and operational efficiencies identified.

In addition to process and operational skills and experience, the candidate needs to be able to strongly collaborate multi-functionally, approach work with a continuous improvement attitude, think strategically, drive clarity, understand the technology industry, and be a problem solver. Detail orientation, decisiveness, and the ability to partner are a must.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?

If this is you, you’ll be working with the Tech Ops Business Operations Manager as a key member of the business operations team. The BOE’s primary charge is to make it easy to run our business. Everything you do will be in the spirit of simplification and accuracy of process and information to ensure data-driven decisions. We aim to minimize firefighting. You’ll complete, improve and develop internal processes and deliver distinct projects as required to optimize the efficacy, agility, and impact of the organization. We partner with the rest of the BOE to develop and lead processes to operate and mature the Tech Ops org. You’ll partner multi-functionally with the team, partners, and central teams to develop and adapt plans to address challenges or changing initiatives. You’ll forecast resource and capacity needs and partner with Finance to develop financial reports and planning for the org. You’ll solve, be challenged to think differently, and evolve processes for the betterment of the organization.

WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH?

In this role, you’ll work with teammates at all levels of the organization. You’ll be on a team that is accountable for operational excellence, financial responsibility, people operations and strategy. You’ll work with your peers and other members of the BOE to deliver operational excellence and collaborate across the board to improve and detail accountabilities and responsibilities in our multi-functional operating model. And you’ll collaborate with peers in other BOEs across Global Technology to continuously improve and provide continuity in operations. You’ll collaborate with the Manager, Business Operations, and partner with Tech Ops management, Human Resources, Finance, Talent & Acquisition and Global Operations team partners.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING?

Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
Business operational background, including financial savvy, human resource, and process development experience
3+ years of Customer service experience
Process documentation and governance
Analytical and critical thinking skills
Effective verbal & written communication skills
Compelling use of storytelling to influence & engage others
Ability to adapt and lead through times of change
Solid project management abilities; capable of prioritizing and balancing multiple projects simultaneously, under tight time timelines and within budget parameters.


NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Scales, mixes and bakes various bakery goods. Maintains proper inventory levels of products and ensures the cleanliness and appearance of the bakery department meets standards. Consistently provides friendly, courteous service to internal and external customers. Performs other related work.

Seeks opportunities to welcome, engage, serve and thank customers. Maintains an atmosphere of friendly, enthusiastic customer service with an emphasis of taking care of the customer.

Package all fresh products following all packaging /handling procedures.

Requirements




Ability to

Work varied hours primarily between the hours of 300 am to 1000 pm in a 24/7 operation; including night, weekends and holidays. Pushing and pulling approximately 100 lb. of product at a time on rack.
Lift objects (i.e., mix) of various dimensions chest high up to 50 lbs.
Conduct visual inspections, read and follow production guides, recipes and product labels, log production quantities, temperature readings, etc. on proper forms.
Catch breads, put product onto trays for baking, operate kitchen utensils and equipment with manual dexterity and hand /eye coordination.

Reach overhead to place product on racks.
Stand, walk and move rapidly for extended periods of time.
Bend, stoop, balance, crouch, push, pull, lift, grasp, feel, perform repetitive movement, and reach frequently.
Handle bakery ingredients.
Perform basic math (add, subtract, divide and multiple) and compute weights and measures.
Perform duties with mental alertness involving potential hazards with respect to baking procedures, equipment, and work aides.
Respond to audible timers on baking equipment.
Perform around equipment and product emitting heat (approximately 465 degrees).

Wear hats, hairnets, gloves, and other personal protective equipment as required.
Check labels and packaging of all manufactured products.
Communicate (hearing & speech) effectively with customers to receive orders and perform customer relation skills.
Communicate in writing to others and read and follow instructions.
Work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment with a strong customer service orientation.
Operate kitchen utensils and equipment with manual dexterity, speed, accuracy and hand/eye coordination.
Demonstrate knowledge of product content and perishability, safety and sanitation procedures and department policies and government regulations.

Food Handlers Certification (Per State Laws)

Consistently provides friendly, courteous customer service to internal and external customers by processing customer orders in an efficient, accurate, safe and courteous manner at a two aisle check stand, a multi station self-check-out lane, or customer service desk as assigned. Performs other related work.

Seeks opportunities to welcome, engage, serve and thank customers. Maintains an atmosphere of friendly, enthusiastic customer service with an emphasis of taking care of the customer.

Consistently provide friendly, courteous service to internal and external customers.
Work varied shifts between 5:00 am and 1:00 am in a 24/7 operation; including night, weekends and holidays.
Perform friendly, courteous, tactful relations with customers and co-workers with composure.
Communicate (hearing and speech) to perform customer relation skills.
Complete written forms.
Conduct visual inspection, read information on merchandise, etc.
Lift and maneuver objects of varying dimensions and weights up to 20 lbs. frequently and perform repetitious work accurately.
Lift up to 50 lbs. occasionally.
Operate check stand equipment such as cash registers, scanners, and scales.
Stand for long periods of time, walk rapidly, bend, stoop, twist, and turn frequently for long periods of time.
Must be 16 years of age or older.
Manual dexterity and good hand/eye coordination.
Learn and memorize a considerable amount of information including PLU codes, location of products, check stand and keyboard procedures and company policies.
Ensure accuracy in recording sales and handling monetary transactions with mental alertness and basic math skills (add, subtract, multiply and divide).
Climb and balance on ladders when stocking shelves.
Use blades for box cutting.
Work in a cooler and freezer.
Use household cleaners to maintain work area (i.e., waxes, glass cleaner, etc.).
Work in varying weather conditions for performance of outdoor duties.
Perform primary duties efficiently and accurately.

Additional Requirements

Food Handlers Certification (Per State Laws).

Machines And Equipment Operated

Fork lift, electric and manual pallet jacks, hand truck, garbage and card board compactor.
Box knife
